cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to slow and meander near/just inland of the coast with eventual drift north-eastward toward southwest Louisiana early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port O’Connor/Corpus Christi

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane watches confined to south Texas coast; no watches along Louisiana coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge warning Port Mansfield TX to High Island TX; Hurricane warning Port Mansfield to Sargent TX; Tropical-storm warning north of Sargent to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island and extending eastward into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) have a 44 % cumulative chance, with onset probabilities rising to 11 % by 96 h; hurricane-force winds are unlikely (<4 %).
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along southwest Louisiana coast (High Island TX to Morgan City) per NHC surge graphic.
weather_observation.rainfall: 7–15 inches of rain possible across southwest and central Louisiana, producing significant flooding risk around Lake Charles.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged heavy rainfall could cause river flooding and drainage congestion that hampers port access; elevated seas and long-period swells may disrupt channel pilotage.
